title: Gary Neville heavily criticises Manchester United board after shock defeat by Newcastle
text:
Gary Neville believes Manchester United have gone backwards after selling the likes of Marouane Fellaini, Alexis Sanchez and Romelu Lukaku but urged the club to 'hold their nerve' with Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and his rebuilding project.

A strike from Premier League debutant Matty Longstaff inflicted a third Premier League defeat on Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's men, who now sit twelfth in the table and just two points above the relegation zone.

Neville believes numerous changes in policy from the club's board, overseen by vice-chairman Ed Woodward, in the post-Sir Alex Ferguson era has resulted in an unbalanced squad that Solskjaer will need time, and more astute signings, to fix.

Gary Neville slammed the Manchester United board after their defeat by Newcastle

Neville is unimpressed by the decisions Ed Woodward and the United board have made

The 1-0 loss on Sunday left Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side two points above the relegation zone

'The quality's not right and they have taken a step backwards. They'd be better off with Fellaini up front with Lukaku, Sanchez up front, there's no doubt,' he told Sky Sports.

'They now need to fix a style and fix a way of recruiting. It is going to be painful and the board are going to need to hold their nerve.

'They've cocked it up over many years. They're responsible for this poor recruitment. They've gone for completely different styles of managers.

'They've now gone with Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and a completely different style. If you change direction every two years and invest £250million along the way with each manager, you're going to have problems.'

The defeat reinforced Neville's belief that United would be better off with Romelu Lukaku

Lukaku joined Marouane Fellaini (left) and Alexis Sanchez in leaving United this calendar year

Despite such a tumultuous start to the season, the former United right-back insists that Solskjaer must continue his 'clean-up job' and secure the sort of funds that were handed to his predecessors.

'Manchester United are now getting the pain that they deserve for poor decisions at board level.

'Solskjaer needs to make sure that the clean-up job that he's doing, which needs to be done for the mess that's gone before him... he needs to make sure that he gets the opportunity to spend that £250m that the others have had to spend so that he can have an opportunity.

''There's things out there that I liked. I liked Tuanzebe and Maguire, there's the bones of a partnership there. Put five or six players of real quality in there. They need to recruit well.

Neville also insisted that Solskjaer must be financially backed like his predecessors

Neville stated that money should help complement Axel Tuanzebe (left) and Harry Maguire

'They got £75m for Lukaku. They got Smalling, Herrera, Sanchez and Fellaini off the wage bill. They probably invested about £40million, United’s board.

'That isn’t going to be enough to correct what’s gone before. The club is paying for poor recruitment.

'Some of the players that have been signed have been good players. But if they’re character isn’t right then it’s a bad signing.'
description: Gary Neville says Manchester United have gone backwards after selling Marouane Fellaini, Alexis Sanchez and Romelu Lukaku but urged them to 'hold their nerve' with Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.
